definition: piece of paper with short note/short letter
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China
fitting snugly/appropriate/suitable/variant of 貼|贴[tie1]/to paste/to obey
piece of paper with short note/short letter

sentences.english: Thou hast taught me in the hornbook.
sentences.chinese: 你已經在字帖上教過我了。

sentences.english: He practiced writing original forms of characters from a copybook of calligraphy.
sentences.chinese: 書法時臨摹的字帖都是繁體。

sentences.english: The model tool made by EXCEL, like chinese copybook.
sentences.chinese: 這個模版是用EXCEL做成的，比較像中國的字帖。

sentences.english: Calligraphy notepads are the best option for primary students that want to practice their writing.
sentences.chinese: 字帖兒最適合小學生用來模仿寫字。

sentences.english: The two women, neither of whom could read, studied the precious slip of paper.
sentences.chinese: 兩個目不識丁的女人都把眼睛盯着這張寶貝字帖。

sentences.english: Which is more important in this copybook, what to write or how to write?
sentences.chinese: 這本字帖是內容重要，還是形式重要？

definition: to copy (a model of calligraphy or painting)
a rubbing from a stone inscription
to practice calligraphy from a model
to copy (a model of calligraphy or painting etc)
to trace over red characters (as a method of learning to write)
generic term for hard writing instruments such as quill pens, fountain pens, ball pens and pencils, as opposed to writing brushes
Ouyang Xun (557-641), one of Four Great Calligraphers of early Tang 唐初四大家[Tang2 chu1 Si4 Da4 jia1]
